description.narrative: Child protection actors have enhanced capacity to prevent, detect, refer, monitor and document cases of violence, abuse and exploitation., which contributes to Access To Justice, Evaluation And Research, Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially the most vulnerable, including girls and those in humanitarian situations, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and child marriage within their families and communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child protection actors have enhanced capacity to prevent, detect, refer, monitor and document cases of violence, abuse and exploitation.

description.narrative: During the year, child protection actors received support to improve services provision for children, especially the most vulnerable. Specific approach to reach child migrant developed through establishment of One Social Welfare Shop in the region of Agadez. As a result, 22,041 children (42% of girls) at risk and or victims of abuse, exploitation and children on the move, including in emergency areas, benefited from quality services provided by the government services and the NGOs trained social workers. 371,558 children have had their birth certificate with UNICEF supported programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of Civil Registrars or other cadres (i.e. health workers, community leaders, teachers act.) who are legally mandated to notify or register births and who have received training on birth notification or registration
Number of children at risk or victims of abuse or violence reported receiving assistance from a qualified social worker (disaggregated by gender)
Number of women and children in humanitarian situations who received Gender-Based Violence (GBV) response services through UNICEF-supported programmes
Number of children on the move who receive protective services through UNICEF-supported programs
Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
